snippet: The two candidates reaffirmed their commitment to accept the results of an internationally monitored recount of votes regardless of who prevails.
abstract: Afghanistan's rival presidential candidates Ashraf Ghani and Abdullah Abdullah issue joint statement reaffirming their commitment to accept results of internationally monitored recount brokered by Sec of State John Kerry and to abide by power-sharing arrangement regardless of who prevails; statement adds little to earlier failed deal, aside from Ghani and Abdullah's pledge to sign it.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ROD NORDLAND
byline.contributor: Matthew Rosenberg and Azam Ahmed contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The two candidates reaffirmed their commitment to accept the results of an internationally monitored recount of votes regardless of who prevails.

headline.main: Afghan Rivals Back a Deal, Once More, for President
headline.print_headline: Afghan Rivals Back a Deal, Once More, for President
